evidence.text:
Person B: Not yet. Not even abroad. They won't admit it officially.
Person A: What do you mean? We have to force them to admit it publicly. A subpoena, a court order.
Person B: We believe we have to keep asking for his release, as if we didn't know what happened to him.
Person B: I've heard it all. Buried in the forest, dropped into the sea from a helicopter, mass graves. It's all rumors. There's no way to know, 'cause nobody will talk. They're afraid of disappearing, too.
